sentences.en: "Leigh," he said seizing my arm to hold me back.
sentences.cn: “莉，”他说着便抓住我的胳膊把我拉了回来。

sentences.en: 160,000 CDs were seized from illegal factories.
sentences.cn: 从非法工厂缴获了16万张激光唱片。

sentences.en: A group of soldiers seized the airport.
sentences.cn: 一队士兵占领了机场。

sentences.en: After two days' exertions, it's the arms and hands that seize up, not the legs.
sentences.cn: 两天的辛苦劳累过后，发僵的是胳膊和双手，腿倒没事。

sentences.en: All of my assets were seized , including my home.
sentences.cn: 我的所有财产，包括我的住宅，都被没收了。

sentences.en: Carpe diem. Seize the day, boys. Make your lives extraordinary.
sentences.cn: 人生就应该是快乐的，要抓住每一天，孩子们，让你们的生活变得非凡起来。

sentences.en: I can't quite seize your meaning.
sentences.cn: 我不太理解你的意思.

sentences.en: It was necessary to seize and control the main strategic points.
sentences.cn: 必须占领和控制主要的战略据点.

sentences.en: Residents said local gang leaders had cashed in on the violence to seize valuable land.
sentences.cn: 居民们说，当地的帮派头子用暴力夺取宝贵的土地。

sentences.en: Seize a horse by the mane, and lead an ox by the nose.
sentences.cn: 马儿抓鬃牛牵鼻.

sentences.en: Seize the chance, otherwise you will regret it.
sentences.cn: 要抓住机会, 否则你会后悔的.

sentences.en: She put diesel fuel, instead of petrol, into the tank causing the motor to seize up.
sentences.cn: 她往油箱里加了些柴油而不是汽油，致使发动机发生故障。

sentences.en: She tried to seize the gun from him.
sentences.cn: 她试图夺他的枪。

sentences.en: Suddenly he seized my hand.
sentences.cn: 他突然抓住我的手。

sentences.en: the government has eagerly seized on the evidence to deny any link between deprivation and crime.
sentences.cn: 政府急切地利用这一证据否认剥夺和犯罪之间有任何联系。

sentences.en: The gunmen were seized at 1 a.m.
sentences.cn: 这几名持枪歹徒在凌晨1点被抓获。

sentences.en: The lady conspired to seize supreme power.
sentences.cn: 该女士图谋攫取最高权力。

sentences.en: The main fear was that both sides may seize upon a ceasefire and free food aid to rearm.
sentences.cn: 最担心的是双方可能利用停火和无偿食品援助的机会重整军备。

sentences.en: The rebels have seized power.
sentences.cn: 叛乱分子夺取了政权。

sentences.en: The wrestlers try to seize hold of each other.
sentences.cn: 摔跤选手力图抓住对方.

sentences.en: They made the big mistake of thinking they could seize its border with a relatively small force.
sentences.cn: 他们大错特错，居然认为以较少的兵力就能够夺取其边境地区。

sentences.en: We are all born flexible but as we grow older, we tend to seize up a little.
sentences.cn: 我们刚生下来时身体都很灵活，但随着年龄的增长，手脚会变得有些僵硬。

sentences.en: We must seize all opportunities to accelerate development.
sentences.cn: 必须抓住一切机遇加快发展.

phrases.tran_cn: 无孔不入；把握任何机遇
把握时机；抓住机会；把握此刻；活在当下

trans.tran_cn: 抓住，夺取，逮捕，扣押，侵袭，把握（机会等）
trans.tran_en: to take hold of something suddenly and violently
if the police or government officers seize something, for example illegal drugs, they take legal possession of it
